item.title: By: jmbouffard
item.dc:creator: jmbouffard
item.description:
Talking about the issues encountered by the VoIP providers, Vonage is getting into more trouble this week. After loosing their case against Verizon they may be forced to stop using the infringing technology (http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20070323-vonage-enjoined-from-using-verizon-patents-stock-plummets.html)..
As IPTV is already deployed by some cable providers on their own closed network infrastructure, the technologies they currently use are probably already patented. We can then expect that the deployment of the industry of "Video over IP over the Internet" will sure be an interesting one to follow.
item.content:encoded:
Talking about the issues encountered by the VoIP providers, Vonage is getting into more trouble this week. After loosing their case against Verizon they may be forced to stop using the infringing technology (http://arstechnica.com/news.ars/post/20070323-vonage-enjoined-from-using-verizon-patents-stock-plummets.html)..

As IPTV is already deployed by some cable providers on their own closed network infrastructure, the technologies they currently use are probably already patented. We can then expect that the deployment of the industry of “Video over IP over the Internet” will sure be an interesting one to follow.
